newsitem.title: BANGLADESH: Dhaka stocks seen marginally down after suspension.
newsitem.headline: Dhaka stocks seen marginally down after suspension.

text.p: Shares on the Dhaka Stock Exchange (DSE) are expected to move marginally lower in cautious trading when the market reopens on Wednesday after the suspension of trading on Tuesday due to a strike, brokers said.
"The bear-run may continue. The retail investors will remain cautious in a falling market," said broker Khurshid Alam.

Brokers said trading might also be hampered by demonstrations planned by the kerb market traders. Kerb traders threatened the demonstrations in a statement on Tuesday to protest continuing falls in stock prices. The DSE index dropped 35.86 points to 996.5 on turnover of 36.2 million taka on Monday. -- Dhaka Newsroom +880-2-506363
